glsa.title: Mozilla Thunderbird: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Several vulnerabilities in Mozilla Thunderbird allow cross site scripting, JavaScript privilege escalation and possibly execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Mozilla Thunderbird is the next-generation mail client from the Mozilla project.

description.p: Several vulnerabilities were found and fixed in Mozilla Thunderbird. For details, please consult the references below.

impact.p: A remote attacker could craft malicious emails that would leverage these issues to inject and execute arbitrary script code with elevated privileges, spoof content, and possibly execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There are no known workarounds for all the issues at this time.
